blogs.title: How to Optimize Sleep for Recovery
blogs.excerpt: Sleep is the foundation of performance. Learn the 3 key protocols to improve your deep sleep scores tonight.
blogs.content:
Sleep is not a passive state; it is an active recovery process. Without adequate sleep, your training efforts are largely wasted.

The 3-2-1 Rule

To optimize sleep, try the 3-2-1 rule:

  • 3 hours before bed: No food
  • 2 hours before bed: No work
  • 1 hour before bed: No screens

For more details, check out this comprehensive guide by Dr. Huberman.

image.seoDescription: A person sleeping in a comfortable bed, representing recovery and sleep optimization.

author.name: Hayden Richards
author.bio: A movement specialist with 20 years of experience, Hayden delivers precision training for high performers - some run companies, some run households...they all require an approach that doesn't dominate their diary.

blogs.seoTitle: Sleep Optimization Guide | WRK Personal Training
blogs.seoDescription: Maximize your recovery with these evidence-based sleep protocols. The 3-2-1 rule explained.

blogs.title: Strength Training 101: The Big Four
blogs.excerpt: You don't need a complex routine. You need to master the Squat, Bench, Deadlift, and Overhead Press.
blogs.content:
Complexity is the enemy of execution. When starting out, your focus should be entirely on the compound lifts.

1. The Squat

The king of all exercises. It trains the entire posterior chain and core.

Ensure your depth hits parallel and your chest stays up.

2. The Deadlift

The purest test of strength. Pick it up, put it down safely.

image.seoDescription: Close up of weight plates in a gym setting, symbolizing strength training.

blogs.title: Nutrition Strategies for Corporate Athletes
blogs.excerpt: Meal prep taking too long? Here is how to hit your macros without spending your entire Sunday in the kitchen.
blogs.content:
Time is your most valuable asset. Your nutrition strategy needs to reflect that.

Batch Cooking vs. Ingredient Prep

Don't cook full meals. Cook ingredients. Roast a tray of chicken, boil a pot of rice, and chop veggies. Combine them differently throughout the week with different sauces.

This takes 1 hour and saves you 10.

image.seoDescription: Healthy food in meal prep containers, representing nutrition strategies for busy professionals.
